newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft's third-quarter profit up 85 percent.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft's third-quarter profit up 85 percent.

text.p: Microsoft Corp.'s fiscal third-quarter profit jumped 85 percent to $1.04 billion, the world's largest software maker reported Thursday, crediting sales of its latest Microsoft Office package.
Net income, equivalent to 79 cents a share, rose from earnings of $562 million a year ago, or 44 cents a share. The latest results beat Wall Street's consensus analyst forecast of 64 cents a share.
Revenue totalled $3.21 billion, a 45 percent increase over the $2.21 billion racked up in the same quarter a year ago. Analysts on average had predicted revenues of about $2.9 billion.
"Worldwide acceptance of Microsoft Office 97 ignited these outstanding results," Microsoft Chief Financial Officer Mike Brown said in a statement.

Office 97, the latest upgrade of the Redmond, Wash.-based company's best-selling software package, was launched in January. It combines "productivity applications" such as word processing and spreadsheets that accounted for an estimated $2 billion of the company's $8.7 billion in the prior fiscal year.
Microsoft makes the bulk of its money from "platforms," including the operating systems preloaded onto new personal computers, which generate about one-third of the company's revenues.
